# Import data - Python


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(reticulate)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: Paket 'reticulate' wurde unter R Version 4.1.3 erstellt
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')
```
:::


## Import Excel data

Read the Excel data set **dataset1.xlsx** and store it into a data frame called **df1**.

Use the [read_excel](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.read_excel.html) function from the `pandas` package.


::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
import pandas as pd
df1 = pd.read_excel('dataset1.xlsx')
```
:::


## Import CSV data

Read the CSV data set **dataset1.csv** and store it into a data frame called **df2**.

Use the [read_csv](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.read_csv.html) function from the `pandas` package.


::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
import pandas as pd
df2 = pd.read_csv('dataset1.csv')
```
:::


## Import Stata data

Read the Stata data set **dataset1.dta** and store it into a data frame called **df3**.

Use the [read_stata](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.read_stata.html) function from the `pandas` package.


::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
import pandas as pd
df3 = pd.read_stata('dataset1.dta')
```
:::


### Additional question

Can you indicate what variable has been modified in **dataset1** between df1 and df2?

::: callout-tip
Use the R function **comparedf**
:::


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
arsenal::comparedf(py$df1, py$df3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Compare Object

Function Call: 
arsenal::comparedf(x = py$df1, y = py$df3)

Shared: 0 non-by variables and 32 observations.
Not shared: 16 variables and 118 observations.

Differences found in 0/0 variables compared.
0 variables compared have non-identical attributes.
```
:::
:::
